Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great for families”
Reviews.Author: Terry M
Reviews.Content: Very modern, well furnished hotel. Great service and fantastic full breakfast buffet with a huge variety of pastries, hot food, cold food, fruit, and drinks. We stayed in a family room, which was huge. Fantastic bathroom. They have one allergy-free floor. Excellent location -- near S-Bahn and U-Bahn stops. I highly recommend it for families. Check the website for deals. Very reasonably priced if you get one of their online deals.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel, which is very different.”
Reviews.Author: Gerhard1943
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 7 days during the I T B Berlin from 5.3.2012 t0 12.3.2012.It is well lokated direct at the famous Ku-damm - West Berlin. It is a 4 Star Business Hotel. Each room in addition to the room number- has a name of a famous moviestar and decorated with photos and posters acordingly. The guestroom floors are assigned to the moviesstars from different countries- for instands - 4th floor - you find the most famous moviestars from the U S A. My room was 403 - the Grace Kelly room -. Hotel has a large Hotellobby, an outsorced Italian Restaurant and Bar. The breakfastroom is large with a great buffet breakfast. The Gym. is not very large on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: CrocIreland
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at this hotel, everything first class, very central and a fabulous Breakfast Buffet, staff very good, all in all a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Ever”
Reviews.Author: vermeer
Reviews.Content: there are plenty of hotel choices in Berlin, however we simply make straight for the Hollywood Media Hotel. Slightly quirky but very comfortable and always reasonable priced. The hotel is owned by a German film director so is individual rather than an anonymous part of an international chain. All the rooms are of an excellent standard. We opted for an upgraded room which means it is slightly larger with a huge window giving a good view. Really well placed for the bars and restaurants of Savigny Platz as well as all the shops on Kurfurstenamm. Sine we last stayed there about three years ago the Media Hotel has maintained it's high standards and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: English-Academic-Sch
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there, we had a great time, really nice, could not fault it. Very happy and would book again. Breakfast was great..everything about the place was nice and well looked after. And so near to everything:) Bus tours, shopping, eating:)

Reviews.Title: “Great for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: nyaredzi
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three-night's stay at Hollywood Media Hotel. It's a nice place, very clean and simple (in a good way). Great location for shopping and sightseeing. We had a standard room and it was good enough. Not much furniture in the room, pillows stuffed with something strange (ok to sleep on though), noisy when you open the window that faces a busy street - that's about all the disadvantages i noticed. On the plus side: - GREAT location. Bus no.109 takes you from the Tegel airport almost to the doors of the hotel. It's a 5-minute walk from a subway station (Uhlandstrasse), the Zoo and the subway/bus/train station are a 20-minute walk away or you can take a bus. The buses no.100 and 200 which stop there are great for a small sightseeing tour of the city, you get to see the Parliament, Brandenburger Tor, the famous Unter den Linden shopping street, the Berliner Dom within a 40-minute drive - not too noisy - good breakfast. Don't let the other reviews scare you - the "strange" things the restaurant offers for breakfast are just chicken nuggets or small pizzas, just choose something else as there is plenty to choose from - very clean - unconventional design that's not too over-the-top. There was only a picture of some director in our room (didn't look very convincing), lots of posters and pictures around the hotel create a nice mood - the Italian restaurant is charming and serves great food Almost forgot a major minus - there's no free Internet in the rooms, you have to pay 2 euros an hour for a connection or use the computer that's in the lobby (rarely free). Overall a nice hotel that's conveniently located. Berlin is a wonderful city and we'd love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than any design hotel(?)”
Reviews.Author: ballodent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights from september 24 to 27 and loved it. All the movie posters brought back memories of magic moments in dark theatres. Exhibitions of scenes from more or less great films is an adventure for both old and young. We booked a comfort room and were very happy with it in every way. As for the rest of the hotel the room was very clean and tidy, nothing lacking, good size, nice furniture, large windows overlooking the Kudamm, and still very quiet. The bathroom not big but sufficient, with everything working. Service is impeccable and the hotel seems to be well managed. Everything about the breakfast is the way you want it to be, with sufficient variety and plenty of good food, even at closing time at 10:30 am. Including sparkling wine! The entrance of the hotel is certainly not a flamboyant one, but who needs that? Last but not least the location could not be better - the area between the Kudamm and the Savigny Platz has all the good restaurants and is right at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Arefaat
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to the shopping area, has 2 nice restaurants in ground floor (Italian & Lebanese). Rooms are nicely equiped, bathrooms are comfortable. Breakfast room is big enough to accommodate the hotel guests, breakfast items and variety are good. Nice place to stay, specially for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kp1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on KuDamm and close to Zoo Bahnhof. Airport bus stops right in front. The hotel and rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the Hollywood decor was a nice touch. Breakfast was excellent. The bathroom had only generic hotel soap, nothing else, so bring your own shampoo etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel on the Kudamm”
Reviews.Author: Breiva
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and good beds. Interesting movie decor throughout. Very good breakfast. Superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, great location!”
Reviews.Author: annanann
Reviews.Content: The location is great. slap bang in the middle of Kurfurstendamm, with bars, restaurants and shopping right on your doorstep. The breakfast is good and our room was adequate. Adequate is a word that describe the whole stay. Nothing was really exceptional, but I have absolutely nothing to complain about either.

Reviews.Title: “Funny and professional”
Reviews.Author: OsloViking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of Kurfürstendamm, western Berlin's famous & stylish boulevard. Although in an expensive shopping street, the hotel has an apparently tacky design (including some funny exhibitions of items from German and international film history). But inside it is a well functioning business hotel. Great rooms (although mattress a too hard surface, a top mattress is needed) and an excellent breakfeast buffet. Noise from the street is heard, but not very disturbing. Precise and discrete service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic can't recommend this hotel enough”
Reviews.Author: AJ6363
Reviews.Content: I have been booking this hotel for myself and colleagues attending an annual trade fair for over 6 years now and I can't recommend it enough. As others have said it is a great location, clean, well appointed rooms and public areas, the staff are the BEST so friendly helpful and knowledgeable. There are plenty of places to eat within walking distance but the hotel's own sister resturants Marooush http://www.marooush.de/ and Capone http://www.capone-berlin.de/ are so good that there is no need to travel far o at least a couple of nights - although we invariabley split our time between the two!

Reviews.Title: “A good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lalou1211
Reviews.Content: Very good location in West. Berlin. Very convinient location. Quite modern theme hotel. Extremely helpful and polite staff. Very clean rooms. Quite rich breakfast buffet. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: foodie831
Reviews.Content: Old time movie themed, on famous Kurfurstendamm Street, this clean, comfortable, upscale hotel is also a short walk to underground train, many restaurants and an amazing number of stores. A huge gourmet-type daily breakfast buffet is included. Staff is friendly and helpful and the location is wonderful. Each floor features movies (and stars) from different parts of the world and every room features particular film star. They even have their own 99-seat movie theater! This place is a real find. I highly recommend it whenever you are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff, fab breakfast and comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: wardv35
Reviews.Content: We had an apartment on the top floor which was spacious, modern, spotlessly clean and comfortable. Our room was at the side of the hotel so really quiet. The apartment had a kitchenette including fridge and hob but curiously no crockery, cutlery or kettle, but that didn't bother us too much. Breakfasts were very good with a wide selection of food and the coffee was great too. The staff on reception were great and really helpful with directions and advice on the Christmas markets. Location was good - at the quieter end of Ku'damm but a short walk from Uhland Str UBahn and on the City Sightseeing Bus Tour circuit (a must). We had coffee and cake in hotel cafe which were ok and can recommend Petrocelli Ristorante (Italian) across the street a bit further down - food good and very reasonable for city centre - we paid 40Euro for 2 mains, salad and 2 glasses wine. Try cafe and food hall in Ka De We - amazing selection of beautiful food.

Reviews.Title: “A most excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CeliaBim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Media June 2 - 9 2010. I had requested a quiet non smoking room and it was great, I slept like a baby! Breakfast was wonderful -good selection staff excellent I give them 5*'s. I forgot the front desk staff very good as well, most helpful with directions around town to a non-german speaker like myself again 5*'s. Must mention the guys in the italian restaurant -great service and wonderful smiles! The Ku'damm is excellent, for all types of shopping. Would return to Berlin in a heartbeat and stay at the Hollywood Media again!!! A must see is the Brandenburg Gate take the walking tour of Berlin you will enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.. pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: lovesylvie
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Michelberger for the first part of my stay and was supposed to return for the latter part of my stay in Berlin.. I did not want to return and spent time while in Berlin searching for an alternative... I chose this hotel from other trip advisor reviews and the location. My friend and I loved this place.. It is great.. comfortable rooms, beds... (I upgraded to comfort room.....sauna/steam etc and breakfast included in price. AND THE LOCATION IS UNBELIEVABLE. fantastic shopping, cafes, restaurants nearby and we had a surprising good meal at Capones- the hotel restaurant. I would go back in a minute

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood in Berlin?”
Reviews.Author: Intelins
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Media Hotel is a nice, quiet and clean Hotel at the Kudamm' in Berlin. The staff is friendly, the breakfast truly amazing i must say. Sleep quality was allright, the hotel features a nice sauna and wellness area that is really worth mentioning! The hotel is not that much dedicated to movies, it's really not an overkill so it's a nice place to go. Maybe a tick too expensive (I paid 100Euro for 1 night with breakfast) but worth staying there. The rooms are individualized, i stayed in the Chaplin room on the floor where the rooms are dedicated to British actors & directors.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,best treatment”
Reviews.Author: massimo2
Reviews.Content: i really recommend this hotel,been there with my wife and 2 years old kids.... the crew in the reception are so kind and helpfull,especially oliver the manager and marie.... the breakfast was very good and rooms too in centered place recommended

Reviews.Title: “perfect complement to a day's sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: alisonherbert
Reviews.Content: Brilliant level of service. Very efficient, friendly staff; nothing too much trouble. In particular, Melanie on reception, Nadine in restaurant and Duty Manager Herbert. Standard and Comfort rooms I found a bit small, but requested an upgrade and was given a lovely apartment with balcony, at same price. Breakfast: huge buffet with everything you could ask for. Very interesting decor with lots to read about with movie theme. Beautifully heated throughout - welcome after sightseeing in wintery Berlin. Lovely area - perfect for class restaurants and bars and boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: anastasias22
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in one of the best streets of Berlin. On Kurfuerstendamm u can find many shops , restaurants and hotels. The hotel is close to tram , buses and metro. The rooms are very clen, the breakfast very good and the biggest advantage is the very kind staff. They were all very helpful and kind. I paid 120 euro per night with breakfast. The decoration of the hotel is based on Hollywood stars and movies that is why every room has the name of a famous actor. Another good thing with this hotel is that u can go to many monuments on foot and that there are great restaurants near the hotel. One last thing, if u visit Berlin u should taste donuts, they taste great. In Greece I havent found so tasteful donuts and u should try breakfast to KDW.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: youngtraveldude
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that met all my needs during my stay in Berlin. Location could not be any better! The second you walk out the door you are immersed in the action! (esp for the women and all the metrosexual guys who enjoy shopping in the awesome stores and boutiques that line Kurfuerstendamm Street, where the hotel is located). FYI...if your young and into clubs like me, you may have to take a sky train a few stops to get to the area of the best clubs. I found perhaps the BEST club that everybody goes to but is not advertised. It was the sickest party i've ever experienced and it started Friday night and continued until Sunday afternoon...they pull shades over the windows during the day to keep the light out. email me for details. ROOM: Super clean and nicely appointed. Wifi (you must pay extra for) in the room and the standard desk, chairs and television. The bed was nice and comfortable with nice soft blankets and lines. Each room is themed after some old Hollywood startlet or legend and their is a picture outside the door of the chosen celebrity. One tip however....make SURE you request a room away from the street. Unfortunately, my room was on the street side and it is a bit noisy throughout the night and early morning due to honks and horns. FOOD: One of the best things about Hollywood Media Hotel is the awesome buffet breakfast!! Make sure that breakfast is included in your room rate, or else you will be left out in the cold. Nice breakfast hours too, for those of us who like to sleep in late. Approx. from 6:30am to 10am, there is a huge assortment of breads, pastries, yougurts, juices, fruits, coffee, plus pancakes, scrambled eggs, bacon, etc. Keep in mind, the breakfast room seems to fill up rather quickly, so you may want to target your breakfast for either 6:30am (right when they open up) or towards the tail end of the morning around 9:30am (before they close)....these seem to be the best times to avoid the crowds. LOCATION: As mentioned earlier, location couldn't be any better!! Situated right next to a Burger King, with all kinds of cool shops and boutiques around. About a 7 - 10 minute walk from the Zoo subway stop. (one of the main stops in Berlin). Overalll, Berlin is a city that really rocks and is alive with youth, energy and a vibrant spirit. Don't hesitate to send me an email if you have any other questions...[--]

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, must return”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugDonegal
Reviews.Content: I organised a group booking for 33 people and everyone was thouroughly impressed with the hotel. The welcome on arrival and the helpfulness of reception staff was excellent. The breakfast was just gorgeous. Lots of choice and confort to enjoy it. Location was great and city tour bus stopped nearby. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Christmas markets added to the overall experience which was undoubtedly memorable for us all. Would highly recommend and hope to return again. Some of the group couldn't subsequently travel and refunds were made with no fuss. One word. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay there”
Reviews.Author: ezpass
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. We had to take 2 rooms since they didn't have a vacant family room. The rooms are plesant and clean, quite small though. The stuff was friendly and helpful - could tell us everything we needed about public transportation, opening hours etc'. The breakfast free buffet was really excellent - reach and tasty, with a variety of food and beverages. Unlike in the States, in Europe they charge for internet access (13 Euro per day) which is pretty annoying. Also, in the bath room there are soap / shampoo (together!) dispensers, instead of regular packs. I didn't like it, but it is really negligible. The location is very good, in walking distance to shopping area, restorants and bars. There are subway stations near by, and major bus lines as well. We paid aprox. 100 Euro per night per room (for two).

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ScottTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days here as a solo traveler. Very nice hotel on Western Berlin's version of 5th Avenue. The room was comfortable and quiet with plenty of space. Good A/C. Very good breakfast (eggs , sausage and the usual European fare of fruit, cereal, yoghurt, breads, salads and cold cuts). The staff was extremely helpful. I liked the movie posters all over the hotel (unfortunately there were no posters or postcards of movies for sale). The 2nd floor was nonsmoking - the 4th floor had American movie stars. Small exercise room with cardio and weight machines. Nearby: Burger King next door. Around the corner and down the block is a grocery store and an internet cafe (3 EUR/hr - hotel charged 8 EUR/hr - 2008). Nice restaurants on Bleibtreu Strasse (side street to the north and west of the hotel). Getting around: The M29 bus was convenient to getting to eastern Berlin (get a transit pass!) The 109 takes you to the Berlin Zoo train station. (the stop is ~100 feet to the west of the hotel). The U-Bahn is about 2 blocks east (Uhlandstrasse). Getting to the Hotel: VERY EASY - At the airport (TXL) head towards the bus depot outside the Main Terminal (buy tickets just inside the terminal or on the bus - 2.10 EUR in 2008!). Take the 109 to Bleibtreau strasse (the stop is after Adenauerplatz and before Uhlandstrasse - I mention these two stops as they are on most maps - tell the bus driver where you want to get off). The hotel is ~100 feet to your left as you exit the bus. If arriving by train, get to Berlin Zoo using the S-Bahn (again 2.10 EUR) then go out front and get on the 109 or 110 bus (free transfer). Again your stop is Bleibtreu strasse (about 3 stops). The hotel is across the street from the stop. I dare you to find a cheaper airport transfer!!! Check the hotel's website for deals (I received a free transit pass with my reservation and a low rate).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: themonstersmam
Reviews.Content: My Husband, our daughter and myself stayed for 3 nights in this fantastic hotel. We had booked a triple room but on arrival were given a family/business suite. The room was large, clean and comfortable. It had a seperate dressing room /walk in wardrobe so all our luggage was out of the way. The breakfast was excellent someting for everyones taste. Everything was very fresh and tasty. It is situated in old west berlin but it is easy to travel to the east side where most of the"sites" are. Though there are "sites " to visit around this area.There are many resturants around the hotel all within a short walking distance especially on Bleibtreu strasse and around Savingy platz. Our favourite was a little german bar/restuarant called Dicke Wirten on Carmerstrasse just off Savingy platz. Good beer and food.If using the S bahn Savingyplaz sation is closer than zoo station. I can recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: Barbara02
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed in May and found the hotel great fun - very different to our usual hotels which normally reflect the country or city we are visiting rather than large hotel chains. The rooms were excellent and large, and the breakfast was very good, with a changing menu each day. The Hollywood theme was a talking point and it is in a good location for sightseeing. We would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, And Great Food :)”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Leicester101
Reviews.Content: This Hollywood themed hotel is situated right near all amenities - Tube station, Bars and Restaurants. I was lucky enough to have a large room, with 2 clean double beds, a good sized bathroom and a great view. The rest my travelling group were not disappointed with their rooms. The breakfast was marvellous, a great choice of food, either the healthy option or the bacon and egg sarnies option! Offering English tea, coffee and fresh milk. All floors of the hotel were of a different nationality, having a movie star representing each room. A gym on the top floor, including a massage parlour, all for a small fee. (It was fully booked when we went!!!) Each morning your room would be cleaned whilst at breakfast, or after returning to the hotel later on, having your duvet and pillows changed, and clean towels. It has some bars that are located just around the corner, and all party life and more bars, are literally a few stops away on the tube – (which is 24hr) Just a short walk away was a great American Diner, ‘Route 66’ – A great place to eat, real value for money. I went to Berlin for my 18th, as part of my travelling ventures. There were people of all ages on this trip with me, and the hotel staff catered for all. Giving us directions for the night life alongside discounts for clubs, they helped with finding our way to shopping places and all tourist attractions. The staff spoke very good English. Due to bad weather, we stayed in the hotel bar, it was brilliant - Open all night, and small snacks brought to your table. My mother booked this through GTAhotels.com website – there was a slight mishap when arriving to the hotel, they hadn’t received confirmation from the Hotel booking company – However, the staff efforts were outstanding to get us our rooms, even late at night and without receiving any confirmation, nor money. It was sorted the morning after.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mellyb1962
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hollywood Media Hotel. We booked a family room and we were not disappointed with the room at all. Clean and spacious, nice bathroom. We didn,t pay the earth for our stay either. Breakfast was as previously stated in other reviews, plentiful and plenty of choice. I would fully recommend to anyone if thinking of staying in Berlin consider staying here, you will not be disappointed with the hotel or the location.

Reviews.Title: “Service wasn't that great”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Media hotel for almost one week when in Berlin for business. The location is FANTASTIC -> right on the Ku'damm and within walking distance to shopping and restaurants. Its also a very short taxi ride (10 minutes) to the Messe Hall if you're in town for a convention. The hotel itself is pretty quirky -> almost gaudy with its bizarre decorations. The rooms are decent sized (for Europe) and the hotel has a gym and solarium (which are small but at least they ahve them). The biggest problem I had was when I checked out a day early. Our company had reserved at least 20 rooms for nearly a week. I had changed my reservation to arrive a day earlier and also check out a day earlier. However, when I went to check out, they still charged me for the extra day when I did not stay. It was most likely miscommunication between my corporate travel agent but I was pretty shocked that they were so strict - espcially since I had arrived a day earlier and also because my company had give them quite a bit of business. In short, I would not recommend staying here if there is any chance your dates of your stay may change.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: Mairmi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Hollywood Media Hotel where we stayed for the past week. The hotel is excellent. Its location is on one of the main shopping streets in Berlin. The atmosphere in the hotel is very relaxed and staff are very friendly and professional. The breakfasts in the hotel are amazing. A huge selection to choose from each morning with a different selection of hot food presented each day. The dining room is run with excellent efficiency and the staff in the breakfast room are eager to please. There is absolutely no shortage of food, either hot or cold! There is also a small gym on the top floor of the hotel which I used everyday and never had to wait as I was the only person in the gym each day! The hollywood theme works very well and it certainly is not 'in your face'. Overall, the location is excellent as there is a bus stop outside the door with a fantastic public transport system. I really recommend this hotel for any tourists in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Triona_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while at a trade conference in Berlin for 6 days. Bascially we booked this hotel because it was the only one available as we were booking in a hurry and we did'nt want to pay too much. We were very pleasd entirely and the hotel is much better than in the reviews. Rooms are large with walk in wardrobe and seperate living area. Lots of restaurants in walking distance. I found the staff very nice and helpful and the hotel has a very homely atmosphere. There is none of the nonsence you see in some hotels with someone watching every step. You can come and go as you please. There are lots of pictures around of famous films and stars but thats it really. It's not over the top. Breakfast is excellent but the tables are probably a bit too close, although the breakfast serves up to 10.30am so you dont have to get up too early but it was'nt too full anyway. The room heater was'nt working so it was cold, but we did'nt persue it as, but this was probably just our room. Apart from that we loved Berlin and the hotel and would definetely stay there again. Triona, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but nice!”
Reviews.Author: Mojie
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a lot going for it. Great location (right on Ku'Damm!), nice clean rooms with comfortable beds, and an excellent breakfast buffet, and good service. The downside -- the whole Hollywood theme thing. It is silly and better suited to a theme park hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to do better!”
Reviews.Author: vermeer
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel with very well equipped rooms. The price is very competitive for such a modern four star. the Hollywood theme gives the place a nice quirky feel. The rooms are a good size. The breakfast room gives you a good choice in a buffet style. The hotel bar is open as long as you are there (until 5am in our case) and all the staff are generally very friendly. The shopping is right outside your door and there are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. In particular Savignyplatz is just around the corner. If you are looking for the tourist sites then you are a 12 euro taxi fare from Checkpoint Charlie, probbaly 2.10 eorous on the inderground.

Reviews.Title: “A very odd place”
Reviews.Author: impavidus
Reviews.Content: The trouble with themes is just that you can't help it being subjective. Say you were an opera buff and one of your clients mistakenly assumed you liked hard rock concerts and took you to one. You would necessarily put a brave face to what it might turn out to be the most excruciating couple of hours of your life, you may even - if you are so brave - pretend to know something about the band that was playing, but in the end you would certainly be glad to get back to your pad and the first thing you'd do (once you regained your hearing) would be to reach for your collection of opera CDs, playing your favourite piece to restore your inner balance. This is exactly the trouble with the Hollywood Media Hotel. If you are a movies buff you are in your element. If, like me, you just watch movies but couldn't give a hoot about actors, actresses and the fickle world of celluloid, then you would be somewhat less appreciative of this hotel's main features. But let's face it, themed hotels belong to theme parks and although some of our most touristy cities in the world may very well be on the verge of turning into branches of the Disney corporation, I have fortunately failed to notice the presence of hotels pretending to have a locally related theme in all of them, let alone the theme of a place thousand of miles from where you are staying. So, the Hollywood Media Hotel can only get away with its theme in a quirky city like Berlin, and in the middle of the Ku'Damm and right next door to a fast food joint, just to add to the authenticity of all that is gimmicky and tacky. By now, you are either completely turned off and are seeking another hotel, or you are desperate to know more about this place. Let's say that its main feature is the Hollywood posters, plastered on every inch of available space around the public areas. Large chandeliers and various other props add to the phoney effect and greet you on arrival (or was it the staff?). If you had a long flight you may be rudely awaken by all these of images screaming for attention, which is exactly what cinema posters are supposed to do. The short trip to your room through the labyrinthine corridors garishly furnished with more posters, and a carpet reminding you of the hotel name around every corner, takes to what is a total contrast to the rest of this establishment, since the rooms are surprisingly and disappointingly bland. Just when you had resigned (or fired) yourself to the idea that for one night or two you were going to move into a Hollywood set, you are instead rudely projected back to the reality of basic 4 star hotels and are therefore returned to galaxy blandness. (There must be a college somewhere for interior designers specialising in this kind of decor - if anyone knows I would be grateful for the information!) With the only exception of a picture of the thespian to whom the room is dedicated to (did I forget to mention that?), there is absolutely nothing else in your room to even hint that you are staying in a themed hotel. In fact, there is little else to remind you that you are staying in a 4 star hotel, since the hotel management has seen it fit to diligently remove every single item of complimentary toiletries from the bathroom, but saying thatm should you feel the urge to get a toothpaste, they would be delighted to offer it to you if you visited reception. How many people may actually bother to ask for their basket of goodies is unknown to me. If you are like me and you'd rather brush your teeth with the soap out of the dispenser, before having to dress up again to get a few floors down to reception to ask for some toothpaste, I suspect the hotel manages to save quite a lot of money with this stunt. Did I omit to say there is of course a bed, a table, a TV and the rest of the stuff you'd normally associate with a hotel room? I am sorry. Of course you do get all that and you don't even have to go down to reception to ask for it. Was the room clean? Certainly. Was the bathroom OK? Well, yes and no, the shower in my room was powerful enough, but the water took ages to drain, which is a sure symptom of either dodgy plumbing or of a blockage with unspeakable remains of previous guests. I promise you, however, that I failed to ascertain which of these options it was, deciding to leave this pleasure to the next guest. Breakfast is served in a large factory like space with rows of tables and chairs and I have to admit you are spoilt for choice and it's on par with any other 4 star hotels around, so full marks here. Would I recommend this place? As I hinted at the beginning you either love this place or hate it. There is nothing wrong with its basic ingredients, and I have to give it to the staff that they are very obliging and welcoming, but it's just like a movie set, scrape under the surface and you are not left with very much at all. If you seek calm and sophistication look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “real great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderKarls
Reviews.Content: spent one night here and was absolutly happy with everything. real great hotel with friendly staff, nice rooms and a great scenery with all that movie stuff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shelly293984
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and clean , well equiped and breakfast is fabulous ! We felt like movie stars and enjoyed every minute. In addition - hotel location is very good . This is rather expensive hotel - but worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Better than many hotels”
Reviews.Author: 52tripper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hollywood Media Hotel in May 2005. It is conveniently located on the Ku'Damm so if you want to do some upscale shopping, it is just right. Our room was clean and seemed to be newly renovated. The buffet breakfast was great including a variety of hot and cold dishes. We bought a city bus pass that we used to visit many of the major sights. The buses are complete with headphones so that you can listen to the tour in your language of preference. A nice feature is being able to jump off the bus at any number of locations and then jump back on when it suits you. The location of the bus stops and place to purchase the tickets is almost outside the hotel door. We give it an above average review because it was clean and fresh and had a good breakfast. For the price it is a better value than many hotels with a much higher price.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Media Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kurfuerstendamm 202, 10719 Berlin, Germany
